title.no-sidewalk: Should there be a No Footpath label here?

curb-ramp.title: Correct Drop Kerb
curb-ramp.example-1-2-3-4: This label is correctly placed at the bottom of a drop kerb

no-curb-ramp.title: Correct Missing Drop Kerb
no-curb-ramp.example-1-2-3: This intersection is lacking a drop kerb
no-curb-ramp.example-4: This pedestrian crossing indicates there should be a drop kerb here

obstacle.example-1: These construction cones are blocking a pedestrian crossing
obstacle.example-2: This tree blocks the entire footpath
obstacle.example-3: This pole blocks the footpath and a drop kerb entrance
obstacle.example-4: This fire hydrant blocks the footpath

surface-problem.example-2: Brick footpaths are bumpy and can be difficult to pass
surface-problem.example-4: There is a lot of grass growing between the footpath cracks

no-sidewalk.title: Correct No Footpath
no-sidewalk.example-1-2: This is an abruptly ending footpath

crosswalk.title: Correct Marked Pedestrian Crossing
crosswalk.example-1-2-3: This label is correctly placed on a painted pedestrian crossing
crosswalk.example-4: This label is correctly placed on a pedestrian crossing with fading paint

curb-ramp.title: Incorrect Drop Kerb
curb-ramp.example-1-2: Footpath to driveway transitions are not drop kerbs unless a dedicated ramp has been added

no-curb-ramp.title: Incorrect Missing Drop Kerb
no-curb-ramp.example-1: Residential paths should not be labeled as a missing drop kerb

obstacle.example-1: There is enough space to comfortably manoeuvre around this pole
obstacle.example-2: This pole located between, but not on these drop kerbs

surface-problem.example-1: Surface problems on drop kerbs should be marked with a drop kerb label with a higher severity
surface-problem.example-4: Normal footpath tiles are not surface problems

no-sidewalk.title: Incorrect No Footpath
no-sidewalk.example-1: Narrow footpaths should not be labeled as no footpath
no-sidewalk.example-2: Driveways should not be labeled as no footpath
no-sidewalk.example-3: Traffic medians should not be labeled as no footpath
no-sidewalk.example-4: Alleyways and side streets should not be labeled as no footpath

crosswalk.title: Incorrect Marked Pedestrian Crossing
crosswalk.example-1: Crossings with no visual indicator should not be labeled as marked pedestrian crossings
crosswalk.example-2: Stop lines for cars should not be labeled as marked pedestrian crossings
crosswalk.example-3-4: Speed bumps should not be labeled as marked pedestrian crossings

mission-complete.body-1: You just validated {{n}} Drop Kerb labels.
mission-complete.body-2: You just validated {{n}} Missing Drop Kerb labels.
mission-complete.body-7: You just validated {{n}} No Footpath labels.
mission-complete.body-9: You just validated {{n}} Marked Pedestrian Crossing labels.

mobile.info-title-no-curb-ramp: What is a Missing Drop Kerb?
mobile.info-title-crosswalk: What is a Marked Pedestrian Crossing?
